page.title: 01The Worth Valley
page.content: {Haworth}is a{Pennine}village at the top of the{Worth Valley}.The{River {Worth}is a tributary of the{River {Aire}and the whole valley is heavily populated and indistinguishable from the suburbs of{Keighley}.Part of the village is in the valley bottom where there are several very large woollen mills only one of which is still manufacturing textiles.The others have been converted to various light industries including the biscuit maker,{Yorkshire Biscuits},which is {Haworth's}largest employer.The railway runs along the valley from{Keighley}to {Oxenhope}and is owned by a private society.The rest of the village climbs up steeply cobbled streets to the church.Beyond the church are the moors.The village of{Stanbury}on a spur of the{Pennines}is an image of {Haworth}200 years ago.
